titleStmt.title: Poetical piety, or, Poetry made pious by rendering into its method observations arising from various divine subjects, useful for these prophane and enormous times : to which is added, a brief alphabetical expositor, explaining the most intricate words made use of in this book, to the conception of a mean reader, and may serve as a remembrancer to the imperfect memory / by William Williams ...
titleStmt.author: Williams, William, of Cardigan.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
